speaker: Frasier
text: Mimsy, wait!  Please, I can explain!

speaker: Mimsy
text: Oh, don't bother!  And I bet you don't even have Tourette's Syndrome!  [_She leaves._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Poop!  Hell, damn!  Oh...  [_She throws a bouquet at him.  He closes the door and tosses the flowers on the table.  A chef comes up to him and hands him two lobsters._]

speaker: Etienne
text: Lose my number!  [_He storms out._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Chef Etienne!  Oh, dear God.

speaker: Niles
text: I hope you're happy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Me?!  You're the one who suggested that flaming kabobs might lend a festive air.  [_Niles picks up the hairpiece he's been stamping out._]

speaker: Niles
text: I didn't know Ben Corbett's toupee would go up like that.  [_He tosses it in the punch bowl and goes to sit on the couch._]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_rising_] Oh, quiet.  Both of you.  It's done.  [_She heads for the kitchen as Martin comes in from the bedrooms wearing a sash._]

speaker: Martin
text: Bongiarno!

speaker: Niles
text: Party's over, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: What, you mean I'm not the Count anymore?

speaker: Niles
text: 'Fraid not.  [_Frasier sits down with Niles._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Why is it that we can't seem to pull off a simple dinner party?

speaker: Martin
text: Because you always go overboard.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but this one was bare bones.  Simplicity itself.  [_Daphne comes back in._]

speaker: Daphne
text: One of your goats just threw up in the kitchen.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ohh....  [_He gets up and heads for the kitchen where a goat is heard bleating. Fade out._]   **IT'S A CHANDELIER**  [_Fade in.  The living room is filled with a drop cloth and a ladder. A pair of workmen are laboring over a very large light fixture.  Niles is coming in the front door._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, hello.  How goes the installation?

speaker: Workman
text: Well, we had to put in a transformer for the DC, so after we pull the wires, brace the beam, she'll be ready to roll.

speaker: Niles
text: [_completely lost_] Ah.  [_Daphne comes out of the kitchen._]

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, Daphne.  [_He goes over and kisses her._]

speaker: Niles
text: You know the Mike Shaw painting that I'm donating to the museum?  Frasier suggested we throw a farewell dinner party for it.  We've invited some fellow collectors.

speaker: Daphne
text: Uh, Niles, I've been thinking.

speaker: Niles
text: Hmm?

speaker: Daphne
text: Come and sit down, darling.  [_She leads him over to sit at the table._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Maybe it's time you stop throwing dinner parties with your brother.

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: You don't exactly have the best track record.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, throwing dinner parties is an art.  It takes time to perfect.

speaker: Daphne
text: No.

speaker: Niles
text: But...

speaker: Daphne
text: No.  [_He opens his mouth again._]

speaker: Daphne
text: No, it has to stop!  Maybe you and I should try throwing a party together.

speaker: Niles
text: You and me?  Such a big step, are you sure?  [_She nods._]

speaker: Niles
text: Maybe it's time we  entertain as a couple.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thank you, darling.  [_She kisses him as the workman comes over._]

speaker: Workman
text: Excuse me, it's after four o'clock.  What if I finish this tomorrow?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I suppose...

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, no you don't.  You said "One day" when I hired you, and that's what it's going to be.  So get cracking, because something's going to be hanging from that rafter by the end of the day.

speaker: Workman
text: Yes ma'am.  [_He heads off as Niles stares dumbfounded at Daphne taking her seat again._]

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, you handled that so masterfully!   As if he weren't wearing that authoritative tool belt at all!!  [_He stares at her in admiration.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Frasier is sitting at a table, writing.  Niles comes in and joins him._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, Niles, thank goodness you're here!  I am simply percolating with party ideas.

speaker: Niles
text: Uh...

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, have you thought of inviting the artist himself?  He lives in town, you know.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes,  I extended an invitation through his gallery, but he declined.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  That's too bad.  Well then, I have come up with the perfect entertainment for our little art crowd.  It's a radical tableau vivant troupe.  [_Niles stares at him._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know.  But they do provide smocks and shower caps, so we're covered.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, Daphne and I are throwing the party.  [_Frasier looks at him, then back to his notes, fidgeting._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne?  Well.  Fine, suit yourself.  It's your painting. I suppose I could just whip up my signature dish.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne's handling the food.  [_Frasier glowers at him._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Lovely.  So you'll be serving those sad brown chunks that make their way from plate to napkin, bypassing mouth completely.

speaker: Niles
text: It's called Piccadilly Beef, and I talked her out of it, thank God.  The whole thing's being catered.  We're having Cornish game hens, wild rice stuffing, wonderful sides and all heat- and-serve.  [_Frasier puts his notepad away in his briefcase._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Stuffin'.  Lovely.

speaker: Niles
text: I think you'd be happy to be just a guest, for once.

speaker: Frasier
text: "Just a guest"!  In my brother's home.  [_rising_]  You know, I've never been just a guest before.  Before, I always felt like family.  [_He puts his coat on as Daphne comes in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh look!  Here she is now: the hostess with the mostest.  [_Niles stands up, looking irritated._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I see Niles told you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  I'm sorry, I won't be attending your debut soiree, Daphne.  I hope that doesn't upset your seating plan.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's going to be a buffet.  [_Frasier looks horrified._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Buffet!  [_He rolls his eyes as he reaches for his briefcase._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if you should need any help, I think you know my phone number.  [_He heads out._]

speaker: Niles
text: Number three on our speed dial.  [_Frasier pauses at the door and turns to give them a dour look._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Number three.  Interesting.  [_He heads out the door as Daphne tries to reassure Niles.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Roz is in the kitchen with Daphne as she is preparing the hens._]

speaker: Roz
text: I can't believe how calm you are. I would be a nervous wreck by now.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I was nervous at first.  But every step I thought "How would Frasier and Niles do this?"... and didn't do that.  [_Roz laughs as Daphne puts the birds in the oven.  Gertrude calls from the living room._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Daphne, I'm home!

speaker: Daphne
text: Coming, Mum.  [_She goes into the living room, Roz follows with some flowers. Cut to - the living room.  Alice is on the floor, coloring._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Where's the video?  I thought you were going to rent "Castaway".

speaker: Gertrude
text: If I wanted to watch someone talk to a volleyball for two hours, I would have stayed in Manchester with your Aunt Evelyn.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, what are you going to do all night?

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, you needn't worry about me.  I'm going to watch a boxing match on pay-per-view.  Ooh, there's nothing like two great, sweaty beasts beating each other senseless.  I miss your father.

speaker: Roz
text: Come on, Alice, it's time to put away your crayons.

speaker: Alice
text: Lookit.  I wrote my name really big.  [_She holds up some papers as Roz sits on the couch._]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, let's see.

speaker: Alice
text: There, and there, and there, and THERE!  [_She points and Roz lets out a gasp of horror as she realizes her daughter has signed the Shaw painting that is sitting on an easel._]

speaker: Roz
text: [_jumping up_] Oh, my God!  Alice!  Oh, Daphne, I am so sorry.  [_Daphne wets down a cloth and comes over._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, it's not to worry.  It'll come out, it's only a little crayon.  [_She rubs with the cloth._]

speaker: Roz
text: That's worse.

speaker: Daphne
text: I can handle this.  Niles has an art restorer he uses all the time.  I'll get his card.  [_She hurries off._]

speaker: Alice
text: I'm sorry, Mommy.

speaker: Roz
text: I know, honey.  But from now on, just only sign your own artwork, okay?

speaker: Alice
text: 'Cause mine is prettier.  [_Roz looks at the painting._]

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.  [_Daphne comes back in._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Here's his business card.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay.  I'll run it right over.

speaker: Daphne
text: Just tell him it's an emergency, we're very good customers.  [_Roz grabs the painting, Daphne replaces it with one of Alice's drawings and covers it with a cloth._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm just glad Niles isn't here.  He doesn't take these things in his stride like I do.  There, another fire put out.  [_She suddenly notices smoke coming from the kitchen door._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, my God.  The hens!  [_They all rush into the kitchen. Cut to - the kitchen as the hurry in._]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, my God!

speaker: Daphne
text: Okay, don't panic.  I can handle this.  [_She grabs an oven mitt and pulls the pan of flaming Cornish hens from the oven.  Roz puts out the fire with a wet cloth._]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, look at that, Daphne.  Now what are you going to do?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I can't call the caterer.  They were doing a big party and we were their last stop.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I know, call Frasier.  He's gotta know some caterers.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, he was upset since I took over his job as Lord Mayor of Party Town, but he did offer his help.  I hope he meant it. Go, take the painting.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay.  Come on, Alice.  Good luck.  [_Roz and Alice leave as Daphne gets on the phone. Fade to - Frasier standing in his apartment._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, you're never gonna get a caterer at this late hour, but don't worry.  I think I can solve your little problem. I'll be right there.  [_He hangs up the phone and looks to Martin, who is watching TV with Eddie._]

speaker: Frasier
text: As usual, Frasier has to save the day.

speaker: Martin
text: As usual, Martin has to hear about it.  [_Frasier goes to the kitchen.  Cut to - the kitchen as he comes in. He opens up the oven and pulls out a pan of Cornish game hens._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Suit up, boys.  We're goin' in.  [_He pulls out the aluminum foil to cover the pan.  Fade out._]  _Act 2  Scene 1 - Niles' Apartment_  **SOMEONE'S IN THE KITCHEN WITH DAPHNE** [_Fade in.  Frasier is putting on an apron and talking with Daphne, who is already in her evening dress._]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.  I need a full rundown of the situation.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I think I told you about the hens, which I burned.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ooh.  [_He goes to the sink and washes up._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm hoping we have enough ice, and... I probably shouldn't have dressed the salad this afternoon.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, lord.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm pretty sure the soup is okay.  [_Frasier goes over to the stove and takes a deep whiff of the soup._]

speaker: Frasier
text: White wine.  [_Daphne hands him the bottle but, instead of adding it to the soup, he takes a big swig._]

speaker: Daphne
text: What do you think?  Will we make it?

speaker: Frasier
text: I won't lie to you, Daphne.  It's bad.

speaker: Daphne
text: I feel so stupid.  I made a big deal about telling Niles how I could handle this on my own.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, listen.  He doesn't have to know.  If you just keep him out of my way, I will gladly play your invisible little kitchen elf.

speaker: Daphne
text: You would do that for me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course, Daphne.  Now listen, I have brought everything I need to make my signature pomegranate honey sauce, all right?  I will need a ramekin for each of your guests.  [_Daphne pulls some small bowls out of a cabinet._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Here we are.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear.  This is bad.

speaker: Daphne
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there are two that are mis-matched.  It's all right if they're all mis-matched or if in pairs, but two is just unheard of.

speaker: Niles
text: [_calling from the living room_]  Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, my God, it's Niles.  What should we do?  [_Frasier grabs his things and steps to a cabinet._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't worry, I'm right in here.  [_She closes the door on him as Niles comes into the kitchen._]

speaker: Niles
text: I am sorry I'm late.

speaker: Daphne
text: Darling.  [_He kisses her._]

speaker: Niles
text: I had the worst time finding miniature easels for the table.  [_He pulls one out of the bag to show her._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, but it was worth it.

speaker: Niles
text: I think so.  The place looks lovely and the new chandelier is absolutely spectacular, but why is the painting covered?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, because I thought a proper unveiling would be an event. We'll do it after dinner.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, why don't we do it after cocktails?  It'll make for a lively dinner conversation.

speaker: Daphne
text: Trust me.  After will be better.  By the way, the kitchen is off limits to you.  You've already slowed me down.  [_The doorbell rings and Niles checks his watch, a pointed look on his face._]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, someone's tediously punctual.  Shall we?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll be right out.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay.  [_He heads for the living room.  Daphne opens the closet and Frasier steps out._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, if he had any resourcefulness at all, he'd know that miniature easels abound at Liliputia Dollhouse and Miniatures.  [_Daphne hurries off to join Niles as Frasier pulls out his cell phone and dials._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad.  Right, listen.  I need you to do me a favor.  I want you to get me my ramekins, all right?  And then bring them here, but come in the back way, so Niles doesn't see you. No, ramekins.  Well, they're small, round, ceramic dishes. I keep them in the lower left-hand kitchen cabinet.  No, no those are tapes dishes.  Right, those are for soy sauce.  Oh, honestly Dad, you know sometimes I don't think you listen to me.  I said sometimes I don't think you... I said sometimes... I see what you're doing.  [_He stands there, fuming. Cut to - the living room.  Niles and Daphne are greeting a couple._]

speaker: Antonia
text: Are we the first to arrive?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you are refreshingly on time.

speaker: Daphne
text: How about some drinks?

speaker: Antonia
text: Sure.  [_Daphne takes their coats as Gertrude comes down the stairs._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Don't mind me.  I'm just down to nick a bottle of the good stuff.  They normally hide it from me.  [_She grabs a bottle from the bar._]

speaker: Daphne
text: This is my mother, Gertrude Moon.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  Antonia and Alex.

speaker: Alex
text: Pleasure to meet you.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Hello.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Mum, as long as you're going upstairs, take the coats.

speaker: Alex
text: Is this the Mike Shaw painting?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.

speaker: Alex
text: I'm dying to see it.

speaker: Daphne
text: Sorry, no peeking.  You'll have to wait 'til the unveiling.

speaker: Alex
text: Hmm, that sounds like a challenge.  You're going to have to watch me like a hawk.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, won't that be fun.  [_There is a noise from the kitchen._]

speaker: Niles
text: What was that?

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't worry, Niles, that's my domain.  [_She starts for the kitchen, then steps back between Alex and the easel._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Why don't you take our guests on a tour of the library?

speaker: Niles
text: All right.  This way, this way.  [_They head for the stairs._]

speaker: Antonia
text: Is it true that you still collect Edwardian utility bills?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes, they're fascinating.  For example, did you know that Sir Arthur Conan Doyle was a notorious water hog?  But, you don't have to take my word for it!  [_He leads the others off.  Daphne goes into the kitchen. Cut to - the kitchen as she comes in._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Frasier.  [_He steps out of the closet._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I dropped a pan.  Everything's all right.

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_calling from the living room_] Daphne!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake.  [_Daphne ushers him back into the closet._]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.  [_Gertrude comes into the kitchen, holding the phone._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: I'm having trouble ordering the boxing match.  I don't understand, this never happens with the nudie programming.

speaker: Daphne
text: Give it here.  [_She takes the phone and the doorbell rings._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, damn.  You answer that, I'll take care of this.  [_Gertrude exits._]

speaker: Daphne
text: You can come out now.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, honestly, Daphne, if these interruptions don't stop, my signature sauce will be reduced to a monogram.  [_He chuckles at his joke, but Daphne is not in the mood._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm using humor to make a point.  [_Cut to - the living room as Gertrude answers the door._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Hello, I'm Daphne's mum.

speaker: Bill
text: I'm Bill...

speaker: Gertrude
text: Don't bother, I'm just lettin' you in.  [_An older gentleman comes in behind the couple._]

speaker: Mike
text: Hi.  Is this the Crane place?  I'm Mike Shaw.

speaker: Bill
text: Mr. Shaw.  We thought we were just gonna see your painting. We didn't realize you were coming.

speaker: Mike
text: Ah, it was a last minute thing.  Call me Mike.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Mike... hello.  I'm Gertrude.

speaker: Bill
text: I'm Bill Talerino and this is my wife Sharon Kwyakowski-Talerino.

speaker: Sharon
text: May I just say that you are our greatest living American artist bar none.

speaker: Bill
text: Bar none!  [_Bill's cell phone goes off._]

speaker: Bill
text: Excuse me.  [_As he answers it, Mike walks across the room to Gertrude._]

speaker: Mike
text: Is there anything worse than making phony conversation with phony art lovers?

speaker: Gertrude
text: Yes.  Living with one.  My son-in-law is the host.  And if you didn't want yer bum kissed, you shouldn't have come, that's all they do here.

speaker: Mike
text: I wasn't gonna come, but my gallery insisted.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, well, I am going to be upstairs watching a boxing match... should you feel the need to get away.

speaker: Mike
text: Ah, I probably shouldn't, but maybe just the first round.

speaker: Gertrude
text: All right, then.  [_She leads him up the stairs._]

speaker: Mike
text: You wouldn't have anything to drink up there, would ya?

speaker: Gertrude
text: Just liquor.  [_They head off to the bedroom just as Niles and the others come back in from the library._]

speaker: Niles
text: So it actually took George Bernard Shaw longer to rectify his billing error than it did for him to write "Man and Superman".  [_Antonia has a glazed look on her face as they finish coming down the steps._]

speaker: Antonia
text: That's great.  Are those the drinks?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  [_The doorbell rings as she grabs a glass._]

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me.  [_He goes to answer the door, saying "Bill and Sharon" and waving as he passes the other couple.  He opens the door to reveal two gentlemen._]

speaker: Niles
text: Thad and Jeremy.  Welcome.

speaker: Thad
text: Niles.  [_Everyone waves and makes noises of greetings._]

speaker: Jeremy
text: Where's your better half?  [_Daphne comes in._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_taking their coats_]  Oh, here she is now.

speaker: Jeremy
text: Oh, I meant Frasier.  [_They laugh, Niles forces himself to join in._]

speaker: Niles
text: My brother's not coming this evening.

speaker: Jeremy
text: But he's always, always, always at your parties.  Frasier and yellowtail carpaccio.  Has the world gone mad?

speaker: Niles
text: Not yet,  we still have carpaccio.  [_Daphne turns to see Alex reaching for the easel covering.  Gertrude comes down the stairs to grab something._]

speaker: Daphne
text: You've got two choices.  You can either walk away from the painting, or you can limp away from the painting.  [_Alex smiles nervously._]

speaker: Alex
text: Walk, please, I think.  [_He turns away as Gertrude heads for the stairs._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Mother, coats.  [_She tosses the coats into Gertrude's arms._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Yes, Master.  [_Daphne heads for the kitchen, giving Alex a glare as she passes him. Gertrude heads upstairs while Bill and Sharon come over to Niles._]

speaker: Sharon
text: We are so sorry, we have to go.  We have a babysitter emergency.  [_Everyone makes noises of sympathy and disappointment._]

speaker: Bill
text: The worst part is we're going to miss dinner with Mike Shaw. I can't believe you got that old hermit to come.

speaker: Niles
text: Mike Shaw is here?!

speaker: Thad
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, where is he?

speaker: Bill
text: He must have wandered off.  I mean he's not at all like I pictured.  Older guy, white hair, cane.  I think he's wearing a plaid flannel shirt.  He's quite a character.

speaker: Niles
text: Really...  [_Bill and Sharon leave as everyone starts to talk excitedly.  Niles, however, has in mind a different person than Mike Shaw from Bill's description.  Cut to - the kitchen.  Frasier is working at the stove and Martin comes in the back door carrying a sack._]

speaker: Martin
text: Here you go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad, finally.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, if you had said "nut bowls" I woulda gotten them right off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, all right, now listen.  I need you to run to the grocery store for me and pick up some sel de mar, some olive topinade, balsamic vinegar, and some English Stilton cheese. Have you got that?

speaker: Martin
text: You lost me after "Sally's mare".

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, fine.  I'll write it down.

speaker: Niles
text: [_from the living room_] Coming right up.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_after him_] Niles, no.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, hide in there.  [_He ducks out the back, but Martin doesn't have time to get in the larder before Niles comes into the kitchen._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Dad!  I thought so!  What are you doing here?

speaker: Martin
text: I just brought some dishes over.  [_Daphne comes in._]

speaker: Daphne
text: You're not supposed to be in the kitchen, Honey.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know what happened, and I don't want to know how it happened, but somehow our guests are all under the impression that Dad is Mike Shaw.

speaker: Martin
text: Who?

speaker: Niles
text: He's the artist that painted the painting that everyone is here to see.  What are we going to do?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's not a problem.  We'll just take your father out the back door and make up an excuse.  [_She pushes open the back door, but Frasier is there and there's no room to pass.  Niles doesn't notice._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Better yet, we'll take him out the front door.  That way people can see him leave.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, but you know zero about art.  Don't say a word or these people will see right through you.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I'm sure a phony would really stand out at this party.  [_The all head into the living room.  Frasier comes back in desperately holding up his shopping list.  Cut to - the living room as the others enter._]

speaker: Antonia
text: Oh, this must be Mr. Shaw.

speaker: Niles
text: I have very bad news.  Mr. Shaw is not feeling well, so he has to leave.

speaker: Antonia
text: Oh, no.  I can't let you go without getting your autograph. [_She holds out a piece of paper and a pen._]  And if you could draw something on it...  [_Martin takes it._]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, actually, I do a pretty good rocket.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no, Antonia.  Mr. Shaw is not giving away art.  Just write "Mike Shaw".  Isn't that nice?  [_He takes the paper and hands it to Antonia._]

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, there you go.  That's for you.  Come along...

speaker: Alex
text: Please, just say a few words about the dry wit of "The Sandwich Maker".  [_Alex makes another try to reveal the painting, Daphne body blocks him back against the couch._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Who wants another tour?

speaker: Thad
text: I do.

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Martin_] Okay, get out.  [_He hustles Martin out the door._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, why don't you show them the secret passageway?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, what a good idea.

speaker: Daphne
text: Come on then.  [_The doorbell rings._]

speaker: Niles
text: I'll catch up with you. [_to Daphne_] Don't let them in the panic room.  [_Daphne nods and leads the others upstairs.  Niles opens the door to reveal a young man delivering an ice sculpture._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, hello.  I'd almost given up on you.  It's lovely.

speaker: Sculptor
text: Thanks.  If you don't mind, I find it's best to get paid while there's still evidence.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, of course, of course.  I tell you what, if you'll just wheel it over there by the dining rotunda, I'll be right with you.  [_Niles goes to the back room.  The sculptor wheels the cart over as Mike and Gertrude come down the stairs._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: The coast is clear.  Come on, let's get a bottle of champagne and go back up.

speaker: Sculptor
text: Hey, you're Mike Shaw!  I studied you in art school. You're a major influence.  [_They shake._]

speaker: Mike
text: Well, that's very flattering.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Well, shall we get back upstairs for round three?

speaker: Mike
text: She's talking about the fight.  Course, the night's still young...  [_Gertrude laughs and they go back upstairs.  Niles comes back in, filling out a check._]

speaker: Niles
text: And here, and that, and here you go, and... thank you.  [_He hands the check over._]

speaker: Sculptor
text: No, thank you.  I just met one of my heroes, Mike Shaw.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes.  In the hall?

speaker: Sculptor
text: No, right here.

speaker: Niles
text: Don't tell me:  white hair, cane, plaid shirt, character?  [_Cut to - the kitchen.  Martin is coming in through the back._]

speaker: Martin
text: Forgot the list.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Niles
text: [_calling_]  Mr. Shaw...

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake.  All right, here...  [_He hurries into the larder.  Martin closes it behind him as Niles comes in._]

speaker: Niles
text: Dad!  You're not supposed to be here!  [_Daphne comes in._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles!  You're not supposed to be here!  [_Thad and Jeremy come in._]

speaker: Jeremy
text: And what's in here?

speaker: Thad
text: Oh, Mr. Shaw, you came back!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I, uh, felt better.

speaker: Thad
text: Then you must tell us about your work.  We're collectors, you know.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, but this is a party.  I, uh, I... art all the time.

speaker: Thad
text: Come on, let's get you another drink.

speaker: Jeremy
text: Fun party.  It's nice to see you step out of Frasier's shadow. I think he might have been holding you back.  [_Niles and Daphne stay behind as the others leave._]

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, I have to get out there before Dad says something stupid. Let's get these hens browning so we can eat as soon as possible. [_He tastes the sauce cooking on the stove._] Mmm. That's Frasier's signature sauce.  Except it's so much better. I think you should send him the recipe.  [_He heads to the living room.  Daphne stands there, nervously.  Frasier comes out of the larder and grumpily tosses a hand towel down._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm holding him back.  Your sauce is better than mine. Honestly, I don't even know why I try. [_He viciously stirs the sauce._] I stand here, slaving over a hot stove and for what?  Does anyone appreciate me?  No!  [_He continues as Daphne dials her cell phone.  Cut to - the restorer's studio.  Roz and Alice are there, impatient._]

speaker: Roz
text: Are you getting close, Mr. Slovotkin?

speaker: Slovotkin
text: These things take time, miss.  Who do you think I am, that mouse in the cartoons that goes fast?  What's his name?

speaker: Roz
text: Speedy Gonzalez?

speaker: Slovotkin
text: No.  The little mouse, big hat and he goes very fast.

speaker: Roz
text: That's Speedy Gonzalez.

speaker: Slovotkin
text: No!  It's a mouse.  [_Roz's cell phone rings and she answers it._]

speaker: Slovotkin
text: This is going to drive me crazy.

speaker: Roz
text: Hello?  I have no idea.  Can't you just stall dinner for a little while?   All right, don't yell.  [_She holds the phone out._]

speaker: Roz
text: My friend wants to talk to you, Mr. Slovotkin.  [_He takes it._]

speaker: Slovotkin
text: Oh, it's very small.  Hello?  I'm going as fast as I can. I'm not that little mouse that goes zip all around.  What's his name?  No!  That's what she said.  He's a mouse!  [_Cut to - Niles' apartment.  Everyone is gathered in the living room discussing art with Martin._]

speaker: Jeremy
text: What impresses me the most is the way you reinvent identity while recording anonymity.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that took years to get down.  [_The others all make sounds of agreement, Niles takes a swig of his drink._]

speaker: Thad
text: Come on, tell us.  What do you think of Warhol?  [_Martin takes a reflective pause._]

speaker: Martin
text: Crap.

speaker: Thad
text: Kienholz?

speaker: Martin
text: Crap.

speaker: Antonia
text: It is so refreshing to have someone speak so candidly.

speaker: Martin
text: And you have to believe me because I'm a fancy-ass artist.  [_He bursts into laughter and they all join in.  Niles takes another gulp._]

speaker: Alex
text: I know, why don't you take us through the house and you can tell us what you think of Niles' art?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sure.  [_They all get up._]

speaker: Martin
text: I've been waiting to do that for a long time.  [_They head off despite Niles' attempts to protest.  Cut to - the kitchen.  Daphne stops Frasier from putting the fowl in the oven._]

speaker: Daphne
text: You can't brown the hens yet.

speaker: Frasier
text: If we wait any longer, their skins will wrinkle and my sauce will separate.  Is that what you want?

speaker: Frasier
text: Is that what you want!?

speaker: Niles
text: [_from living room_] Daphne?

speaker: Frasier
text: Damn it.  [_He goes back into the closet.  Niles comes into the kitchen._]

speaker: Daphne
text: YOU'RE NOT SUPPOSED TO BE IN HERE!  [_Niles reels backwards, falling through the doorway.  He sheepishly looks back in around the door._]

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, Dad's run amok. [_He comes back in._] Why aren't the hens browning?  [_He opens the oven door and grabs the pan.  Daphne hurries over and closes the oven._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Because they're not ready yet.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, they look ready.  [_He opens the door, but she closes it again._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, well, they're not.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we'll just serve them as is.

speaker: Daphne
text: You can't, they're not brown.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we're going to.  I'm going to get a platter.  [_He opens up the larder as Daphne rushes to reclose it._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't open that door!  [_He opens the door again and she closes it again._]

speaker: Niles
text: Stop that, I already saw him. [_opening the door_]  What are you doing here?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_stepping out into the kitchen_] I am saving your party, that's what I'm doing.

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: You don't have to explain.  Frasier's presence here is clearly why this party's gone awry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh really?  Well, if that's what you think, then I will gladly take MY signature sauce and go.  [_He grabs the pan and heads for the door._]

speaker: Niles
text: Your signature sauce...

speaker: Frasier
text: And that reminds me.  You won't be needing to use my poultry shears.  [_He grabs them off the counter and Niles grabs the pan._]

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, you can't  It's already here, it's already here.

speaker: Frasier
text: This is mine!

speaker: Niles
text: No, no!  It's on my property!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, stop it, stop it, both of you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine!  [_He lets go of the pan.  It flips up and coats Niles with sauce as he falls back through the swinging door.  Cut to - the living room as he stumbles in and everyone gasps.  Frasier and Daphne follow._]

speaker: Niles
text: What have you done?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not sorry, you've been asking for this for years!  [_He stands there, furious, holding the shears as everyone looks on in shock._]

speaker: Daphne
text: No, it's not what you think.  See?  Yummy.  [_She takes a blob of sauce on her finger and licks it up.  Everyone covers their eyes in horror._]

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, it's sauce.  We just had a little kitchen mishap. We'll just get this cleaned up.  [_Martin grabs the cloth covering the easel and hands it to Niles._]

speaker: Martin
text: Here, wipe it on this.

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks Dad.  [_Everyone stares at Alice's drawing which has been revealed._]

speaker: Alex
text: That is no Mike Shaw.

speaker: Niles
text: What happened to my painting?

speaker: Thad
text: Did you know about this, Mike?

speaker: Martin
text: I may have.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, give it up, Martin.  This isn't Mike Shaw, it's Niles' father.

speaker: Alex
text: What are you trying to pull, Crane?  [_Niles can only stand there, trying to think._]

speaker: Jeremy
text: This is uncomfortable.  We should go.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, no, no, please!  Listen  to me, listen.  Yes, there's been some deception and things have gotten out of hand, but no real harm has been done.  I made some mistakes.  People make mistakes, but that's no reason to abandon them.  This night can still be a success.  We've got the food and you're all here and when I tell you about what happened, we'll all have a good laugh about it.  So, please, everybody stay.  [_The guests all think for a minute then say "All right."_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Well done, Daphne.  [_Everyone starts to look happy again, but then there is an ominous groaning and creaking from the ceiling above them.  The new chandelier begins to shake and chime.  Everyone steps back, climbing over furniture in some cases, as it gets louder and more violent.  Suddenly, the ceiling caves in and the chandelier crashes to the floor, shortly followed by an enormous four poster bed that falls through from the floor above.  Gertrude and Mike push their way out from under a pile of coats, where they've been snuggling._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Hello.  [_Everyone simply stands there, stunned for several moments._]

speaker: Daphne
text: All right.  Get your coats.  [_The guests all step over to the bed and claim their garments.  Frasier walks over and puts his arm around a crestfallen Daphne._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, congratulations.  You're now officially a Crane.  [_Daphne breaks down into tears at this.  Fade out._]
